The Amazon basin is one of the largest ecosystems in the world and plays a significant role in the global climate, hydrological cycle and carbon fixation. Lipid markers were investigated to underst and and reconstruct environmental regimes in short cores of lakes in the Tapaj√≥s River (Tapar√≠ Lake), Amazon River (Comprido Lake), Madeira River (Puruzinho Lake) and S√£o Manuel River (Barro Preto Lake) in the Amazon Basin with different types of water: bl ack, white and clear. Aliphatic fraction from the lipid extracts , were analyzed by GC/MS, GC -FID and GC/C/IRMS for individual compounds . The four cores presented distinct n-alkane origin profiles . Barro Preto Lake presented bimodal profile with an odd/eve n prevalence on the entire chromatographic fingerpri nt, with a predominance of higher plants. The Puruzinho Lake profile was bimodal with even/odd carbon predominance in the range of n-C16 to n-C22 with Cmax at n-C18, suggesting the presence of non -photosy nthetic bacteria , such as for the Tapar√≠ Lake. Comprido Lake presented a unimodal profile ( n-C23 to n-C35) indicating the contribution of terrestrial plants. The presence of des -A-terpenoids, a biomarker predominantly of vegetal origin, was detected in the cores , which is al so an anoxic environment marker. The Barro Preto and Comprido Lake sediment s showed the highest concentrations of des -A-terpenoids (average 34 ng g-1 TOC-1 and 23 ng g-1 TOC-1, respectively ) and Tapar√≠ Lake and Puruzinho the lowest (average 3 ng g-1 TOC-1 and 10 ng g-1 TOC-1).The values for ÔÅ§ÔÄ±3C isotopic composition of individual n-alkanes C 27-C31 of the 4 cores varied between -32 and -38 ‚Ä∞ indicat ing contribution of C3 higher plants, while depleted values of ÔÅ§13C from -42 to -52 ‚Ä∞, determined for C20-C27 n-alkane, point ed to the presence of methanogenic bacteria, in the Barro Preto core, as well as the - 42 ‚Ä∞ value for the diploptene . The n-alkanes contribution was evaluated and was possible to determine the vegetation and origin of the predominant organic matter, although it is not possible to determine if there is a relationship with the type of water, since the organic matter may be of lentic (from the lake itself) or lotic origin (transported by the river in the flooded season). The analysis of terpenoids, more specifically des -A-terpenoid es, can be applied to differ blackwater lakes, which may be related to anoxic sediments, since Barro Preto and Comprido Lake presented the highest relative concentrations of des -A- terpenoids.
